comment: Dr. Lee is the best professor I've ever had—extremely knowledgeable and always willing to help. Homework assignments count as attendance. He provides great feedback on homework. There are 4 noncumulative exams, and the final exam can replace your lowest exam grade. Be sure to practice the study guide problems, similar to what's on the exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Prof Lee is the best professor I have had at KSU so far. Though the material is challenging at times, I can tell you that Prof Lee tries his best to make you understand. I can genuinely say he is a fantastic person and professor who truly cares. Please take him if you can!

Matthew Lee is one of the best professors I've had. Although attendance isn't mandatory, He made going to class worthwhile. He's funny and very engaging with the content. You will do well if you keep up with the homework and complete the study guides. He's an all-around great guy, highly recommend!!

Great professor all around, great lectures and more then willing to take extra time to help. Homework assignments are to be turned in every class, so attendance is mandatory in that sense. Several tests, but more than enough resources to succeed. Pay attention and you will be fine. 10/10

He is a great professor. I began the semester with strait A's on exams and the got strait F's but the homeworks and bonus quizzes helped so much to cushion my overall average. He is very willing to help students understand and go over the topic again. Highly recommend him!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Absolute Sigma Chad Professor. Gives plenty of bonus points and give you every chance to succeed. The subject matter can be difficult, but he explains it thoroughly

I left the low rating a while ago, and ended up receiving a C in the course. I have retaken the course with professor Kahn because I wanted a better grade than a C and it's become abundantly clear to me that this is just a difficult course to take and professor Lee actually was a fine professor. Also so is professor Kahn.

comment: If you have half a brain, you will get an A in this class. If you are reading this, take his course before it's too late. He truly cares about his students' success and explains everything perfectly. Take this course, PLEASE!

comment: My personal experience with the course has been negative. The professor is a great man and brilliant to boot, however the tests are extremely difficult, and much different than that of the homework which he proclaims the questions come from. It's not impossible to succeed in this course, but it requires going above and beyond.
